Nothing in the folder is Japanese and the dragon tsuba looks like a casting=
.
Also, swords were made for China export by the Ashikaga shoguns during th=
e
early Muromachi period and presumably they were mounted with Japanese
fit=
tings. But I would be very, very surprised if a Chinese emperor, or any
oth=
er Chinese for that matter, would order specific fittings made for such
bla=
des.

Gordon

Dear People,

Well...  I opine this is not Japanese at all and =
certainly not old.  It is a
recent copy made in China, as evidenced by the =
five claws and the style of
the
dragon.  This is NOT IMHO a Japanese work. =
 Note also the crude asymmetry in
what purports to be a nakago ana!!!

Best=
 regards,

Barry Thomas
(Melbourne, Australia)
